description: A grandson of the creator of the Red Bull energy drink has been arrested after a Ferrari he was driving struck a police officer and dragged his dead body down a Bangkok street.
title: Red Bull Heir Arrested in Traffic Death in Thailand
title_page: Red Bull Heir Arrested in Traffic Death in Thailand - The New York Times
maintext: A grandson of the creator of the Red Bull energy drink has been arrested after a Ferrari he was driving struck a police officer and dragged his dead body down a Bangkok street, the police said Monday. The police questioned the suspect, Vorayuth Yoovidhya, 27, after tracing oil streaks for several blocks to his family’s gated estate in Bangkok. He said that the officer’s motorcycle abruptly cut in front of his vehicle, said Maj. Gen. Anuchai Lekbamroong, the lead investigator. Mr. Vorayuth was released on bail. He is the grandson of Chaleo Yoovidhya, the founder of Red Bull and one of Thailand’s wealthiest men. Mr. Chaleo died in March.
